title: CDC Daily County-Level Ozone Concentrations 2001-2019
description: This dataset provides modeled predictions of ozone levels from the EPA's Downscaler model. These data are used by the CDC's National Environmental Public Health Tracking Network to generate air quality measures. Data are at the county levels for 2001-2014. The dataset includes the maximum, median, mean, and population-weighted mean concentration.
creator: Environmental Public Health Tracking Network
Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
National Oceanic and Atmospheric Administration  (NOAA)
publisher: Centers for Disease Control and Prevention
provider: Healthy Regions & Policies Lab, University of Illinois, Urbana-Champaign
data_variables: Maximum estimated 8-hour average ozone concentration in parts per billion (ppb) within 3 meters of the surface of the earth for the county
Median estimated 8-hour average ozone concentration in parts per billion (ppb) within 3 meters of the surface of the earth for the county
Mean estimated 8-hour average ozone concentration in parts per billion (ppb) within 3 meters of the surface of the earth for the county
Population-weighted estimated 8-hour average ozone concentration in parts per billion (ppb) within 3 meters of the surface of the earth for the county
